019package com.bewsoftware.utils.reflect;
020
021import java.lang.reflect.*;
022
023import static com.bewsoftware.utils.string.Strings.requireNonBlank;
024import static java.util.Objects.requireNonNull;
025
026/**
027 * The primary purpose of this class, is to assist in Unit Testing classes
028 * with hidden members.
029 * <p>
030 * By using reflection, testing can be done without
031 * requiring the changing of the public interface of the class.
032 * <br>
033 * In addition, reflection allows the testing of the internal code to help
034 * maintain required end results.
035 *
036 * @author <a href="mailto:bw.opensource@yahoo.com">Bradley Willcott</a>
037 *
038 * @since 1.0.5
039 * @version 1.0.7
040 */
041public final class Reflect
042{
043    /**
044     * This class is not meant to be instantiated.
045     */
046    private Reflect()
047    {
048    }
049
050    /**
051     * Get access to a private attribute/field of a class instance.
052     * <p>
053     * Example:<br>
054     * The follow classes would be in separate files: {@code Person.java} and
055     * {@code Main.java}.<br>
056     * <br><hr>
057     * {@snippet internal:
058     * public class Person {
059     *     private String name;
060     *
061     *     private Person() {
062     *         name = "not set";
063     *     }
064     *
065     *     public String toString() {
066     *         return "Person { name = " + name + " }";
067     *     }
068     * }
069     *
070     * public class Main {
071     *     public static void main() {
072     *         Person person = Reflect.instantiatePrivateClass(Person.class);
073     *         Field name = Reflect.getPrivateAttribute(person, "name");
074     *         name.set(person, "Fred Smith");
075     *         System.out.println("name = " + name.get(person));
076     *         System.out.println(person);
077     * }
078     * }
079     * }
080     * <hr>
081     * {@snippet internal:
082     * name = Fred Smith
083     * Person { name = Fred Smith }
084     * }
085     *
086     * @param instance The instantiated Class object.
087     * @param name     The name of the class attribute to get.
088     *
089     * @return The Field object representing the required class attribute,
090     *         or <i>null</i> if not found.
091     *
092     * @throws IllegalArgumentException     if {@code name} is <i>blank</i>.
093     * @throws NullPointerException         if either {@code instance} or
094     *                                      {@code name} are <i>null</i>.
095     * @throws ReflectiveOperationException if a reflective operation failed.
096     */
097    public static Field getPrivateAttribute(Object instance, String name) throws ReflectiveOperationException
098    {
099        Field field = null;
100
101        // instance and name must NOT be null.
102        requireNonNull(instance, "instance");
103        requireNonBlank(name, "name");
104
105        try
106        {
107            field = instance.getClass().getDeclaredField(name);
108            requireNonNull(field, "field").setAccessible(true);
109
110        } catch (NullPointerException ex)
111        {
112            // Do nothing - return null.
113
114        } catch (NoSuchFieldException | SecurityException ex)
115        {
116            throw new ReflectiveOperationException(ex);
117        }
118
119        return field;
120    }
121
122    /**
123     * Get access to a private method of a class instance.
124     * <p>
125     * Example:<br>
126     * The follow classes would be in separate files: {@code Person.java} and
127     * {@code Main.java}.<br>
128     * <br><hr>
129     * {@snippet internal:
130     * public class Person {
131     *     private String name;
132     *
133     *     private Person() {
134     *         name = "not set";
135     *     }
136     *
137     *     private String getName() {
138     *         return name;
139     *     }
140     *
141     *     private void setName(String name) {
142     *         this.name = name;
143     *     }
144     *
145     *     public String toString() {
146     *         return "Person { name = " + name + " }";
147     *     }
148     * }
149     *
150     * public class Main {
151     *     public static void main() {
152     *         Person person = Reflect.instantiatePrivateClass(Person.class);
153     *         Method setName = Reflect.getPrivateMethod(person, "setName", "text");
154     *         Method getName = Reflect.getPrivateMethod(person, "getName");
155     *         setName.invoke(person, "Peter Adams");
156     *         System.out.println("name = " + getName.invoke(person));
157     *         System.out.println(person);
158     * }
159     * }
160     * }
161     * <hr>
162     * {@snippet internal:
163     * name = Peter Adams
164     * Person { name = Peter Adams }
165     * }
166     *
167     * @param instance   The instantiated Class object.
168     * @param name       The name of the class attribute to get.
169     * @param sampleArgs Sample arguments/parameters. Used only to obtain their
170     *                   Class&lt;?&gt; types.
171     *
172     * @return The Method object representing the required class method, or
173     * <i>null</i> if not found.
174     *
175     * @throws IllegalArgumentException     if {@code name} is <i>blank</i>.
176     * @throws NullPointerException         if either {@code instance} or
177     *                                      {@code name} are <i>null</i>.
178     * @throws ReflectiveOperationException if a reflective operation failed.
179     */
180    public static Method getPrivateMethod(Object instance, String name, Object... sampleArgs) throws ReflectiveOperationException
181    {
182        Class<?>[] types = null;
183        Method method = null;
184        int length = sampleArgs.length;
185
186        // instance and name must NOT be null.
187        requireNonNull(instance, "instance");
188        requireNonBlank(name, "name");
189
190        if (length > 0)
191        {
192            types = new Class<?>[length];
193
194            for (int i = 0; i < length; i++)
195            {
196                types[i] = sampleArgs[i].getClass();
197            }
198        }
199
200        try
201        {
202            method = instance.getClass().getDeclaredMethod(name, types);
203            requireNonNull(method, "method").setAccessible(true);
204
205        } catch (NullPointerException ex)
206        {
207            // Do nothing - return null.
208
209        } catch (NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException ex)
210        {
211            throw new ReflectiveOperationException(ex);
212        }
213
214        return method;
215    }
216
217    /**
218     * Instantiate a class with a private parameterized constructor. To access
219     * the default constructor, only provide the {@code clazz} parameter.<p>
220     * Example:<br>
221     * The follow classes would be in separate files: {@code Person.java} and
222     * {@code Main.java}.<br>
223     * <br>
224     * {@snippet internal:
225     * public class Person {
226     *     private String name;
227     *
228     *     private Person() {
229     *         name = "not set";
230     *     }
231     *
232     *     private Person(String name) {
233     *         this.name = name;
234     *     }
235     *
236     *     public String toString() {
237     *         return "Person { name = " + name + " }";
238     *     }
239     * }
240     *
241     * public class Main {
242     *     public static void main() {
243     *         Person person = instantiatePrivateClass(Person.class);
244     *         System.out.println(person);
245     *
246     *         person = instantiatePrivateClass(Person.class, "Jane Doe");
247     *         System.out.println(person);
248     * }
249     * }
250     * }
251     * <hr>
252     * {@snippet internal:
253     * Person { name = not set }
254     * Person { name = Jane Doe }
255     * }
256     *
257     * @param <T>   The type of the reference.
258     * @param clazz The class to instantiated.
259     * @param args  The parameters to be passed to the constructor.
260     *
261     *
262     * @return The newly instantiated object, or <i>null</i> if the required
263     *         constructor is not found.
264     *
265     * @throws NullPointerException         if {@code clazz} is <i>null</i>.
266     * @throws ReflectiveOperationException if a reflective operation failed.
267     */
268    public static <T> T instantiatePrivateClass(Class<T> clazz, Object... args)
269            throws ReflectiveOperationException
270    {
271        Class<?>[] types = null;
272        T rtn = null;
273        int numParams = args.length;
274
275        // clazz must NOT be null.
276        requireNonNull(clazz, "clazz");
277
278        // Setup the types array.
279        if (numParams > 0)
280        {
281            types = new Class<?>[numParams];
282
283            for (int i = 0; i < numParams; i++)
284            {
285                types[i] = args[i].getClass();
286            }
287        }
288
289        try
290        {
291            // Get the array of Constructors.
292            Constructor<?>[] cons = clazz.getDeclaredConstructors();
293
294            // Check through all constructors to find what we need.
295            for (Constructor<?> con : cons)
296            {
297                // Only looking for 'private' constructors with
298                // the same number of parameters as 'args'.
299                if (Modifier.isPrivate(con.getModifiers()) && con.getParameterCount() == numParams)
300                {
301                    rtn = checkConstructorSignature(numParams, con, types, rtn, args);
302                }
303            }
304        } catch (IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException
305                | InstantiationException | SecurityException | InvocationTargetException ex)
306        {
307            throw new ReflectiveOperationException(ex);
308        }
309
310        return rtn;
311    }
312
313    /**
314     * Check the signature of the constructor.
315     *
316     * @param <T>       The type of the reference.
317     * @param numParams The number of required parameters.
318     * @param con       The constructor to check.
319     * @param types     Class types of the required parameters.
320     * @param rtn       Provides the return type reference.
321     * @param args      List of arguments to pass to the constructor on
322     *                  instantiation.
323     *
324     * @return The new instantiated object, or the value of the parameter:
325     *         {@code rtn}.
326     *
327     * @throws IllegalAccessException    if this {@code Constructor} object
328     *                                   is enforcing Java language access
329     *                                   control and the underlying
330     *                                   constructor is inaccessible.
331     * @throws InstantiationException    if the class that declares the
332     *                                   underlying constructor represents an
333     *                                   abstract class.
334     * @throws InvocationTargetException if the underlying constructor
335     *                                   throws an exception.
336     */
337    @SuppressWarnings(
338            {
339                "unchecked", "AssignmentToMethodParameter"
340            })
341    private static <T> T checkConstructorSignature(
342            int numParams, Constructor<?> con, Class<?>[] types, T rtn, Object[] args
343    )
344            throws IllegalAccessException, InvocationTargetException, InstantiationException
345    {
346
347        int found = 0;
348
349        // Make sure it has the right signature.
350        if (numParams > 0)
351        {
352            Class<?>[] params = con.getParameterTypes();
353
354            // Cycle through the parameters.
355            for (int i = 0; i < numParams; i++)
356            {
357                // If match on class type...
358                if (params[i] == types[i]
359                        || params[i].isPrimitive()
360                        && Primitives.isWrapperFor(params[i].getName(), types[i].getName()))
361                {
362                    found++;
363                }
364            }
365        }
366
367        if (found == numParams)
368        {
369            con.setAccessible(true);
370            rtn = (T) con.newInstance(args);
371        }
372
373        return rtn;
374    }
375
376    /**
377     * Used for matching primitives and their wrapper classes.
378     *
379     * @since 1.0.5
380     * @version 1.0.6
381     */
382    private static class Primitives
383    {
384
385        /**
386         * The list used in the comparison.
387         */
388        private static final String[][] THE_LIST =
389        {
390            {
391                "boolean", "java.lang.Boolean"
392            },
393            {
394                "byte", "java.lang.Byte"
395            },
396            {
397                "char", "java.lang.Character"
398            },
399            {
400                "double", "java.lang.Double"
401            },
402            {
403                "float", "java.lang.Float"
404            },
405            {
406                "long", "java.lang.Long"
407            },
408            {
409                "int", "java.lang.Integer"
410            },
411            {
412                "short", "java.lang.Short"
413            }
414        };
415
416        /**
417         * Not to be instantiated. Class contains only static methods.
418         */
419        private Primitives()
420        {
421        }
422
423        /**
424         * Determines whether or not the named class is the wrapper class
425         * for the named primitive type.
426         *
427         * @param primitive Name of primitive.
428         * @param className Name of class.
429         *
430         * @return {@code true} if it is, {@code false} otherwise.
431         *
432         * @throws NullPointerException     if either {@code primitive} or
433         *                                  {@code className} are <i>null</i>.
434         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if either {@code primitive} or
435         *                                  {@code className} are <i>blank</i>.
436         */
437        public static boolean isWrapperFor(String primitive, String className)
438        {
439            requireNonBlank(primitive, "primitive");
440            requireNonBlank(className, "className");
441
442            // Linear search for primitive in the list.
443            for (String[] entry : THE_LIST)
444            {
445                // Have we a found the primitive?
446                // Is 'className' the wrapper class?
447                if (entry[0].equals(primitive) && entry[1].equals(className))
448                {
449                    return true;
450                }
451            }
452
453            return false;
454        }
455    }
456}
